Omitted Patient History.text: The patient, with a history of hypertension and high-grade invasive urothelial carcinoma (pT2b)
Omitted Patient History.omittedDetails: omitted details about bladder cancer diagnosis stages T1 and T4.

Omitted Symptoms/Diagnosis/Surgical Proc.text: CT and CTA showed changes in pelvic fluid collections and severe bilateral hydronephrosis.
Omitted Symptoms/Diagnosis/Surgical Proc.omittedDetails: CTA also revealed a tiny hepatic lesion segment, requiring attention on subsequent follow-ups

Omitted Symptoms/Diagnosis/Surgical Proc.text: Transitioned to IV ertapenem for 4 weeks.
Omitted Symptoms/Diagnosis/Surgical Proc.omittedDetails: The duration of IV ertapenem should also be determined by fluid collection changes on repeat imaging outpatient basis
the summary did not mention that the serosanguinous fluid was from both admission and discharge exams.

Omitted Medicine related instructions.text: IV antibiotics for several weeks as determined by ID team.
Omitted Medicine related instructions.omittedDetails: Transition to IV ertapenem with final length of treatment determined by fluid collection changes on repeat imaging.

Omitted Medicine related instructions.text: Weekly lab draws and follow-up appointments as specified.
Omitted Medicine related instructions.omittedDetails: Weekly lab draws should include CBC with differential, BUN, Cr, AST, ALT, TB, ALK PHOS.

Omitted Followup.text: Follow up with infectious disease and urology.
Omitted Followup.omittedDetails: Infectious disease follow-up needs to be after her CT abdomen/pelvis has already been done. Also, follow-up with hem/onc regarding breast and lung/peritoneum lesions.
